trans-unit.source: How to Detach a Data Disk from a Virtual Machine with the CLI
trans-unit.target: How to Detach a Data Disk from a Virtual Machine with the CLI

trans-unit.source: When you no longer need a data disk that is attached to a virtual machine, you can easily detach it.
trans-unit.target: When you no longer need a data disk that is attached to a virtual machine, you can easily detach it.

trans-unit.source: This removes the disk from the virtual machine, but doesn't remove it from storage.
trans-unit.target: This removes the disk from the virtual machine, but doesn't remove it from storage.

trans-unit.source: If you want to use the existing data on the disk again, you can reattach it to the same virtual machine, or another one.
trans-unit.target: If you want to use the existing data on the disk again, you can reattach it to the same virtual machine, or another one.

trans-unit.source: A virtual machine in Azure uses different types of disks: an operating system disk, a local temporary disk, and optional data disks.
trans-unit.target: A virtual machine in Azure uses different types of disks: an operating system disk, a local temporary disk, and optional data disks.

trans-unit.source: Data disks are the recommended way to store data for a virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Data disks are the recommended way to store data for a virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: For details about disks, see <link><linkText>About disks and images</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For details about disks, see <link><linkText>About disks and images</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: It is not currently possible to detach an operating system disk.
trans-unit.target: It is not currently possible to detach an operating system disk.

trans-unit.source: Get the list of disks attached to your VM:
trans-unit.target: Get the list of disks attached to your VM:

trans-unit.source: If you omit , you will get a list of all disks in your subscription.
trans-unit.target: If you omit , you will get a list of all disks in your subscription.

trans-unit.source: lun identifies the disk to be detached, and will be a number which can be found in your VM's disk list.
trans-unit.target: lun identifies the disk to be detached, and will be a number which can be found in your VM's disk list.
